title.title: When trouble arises
Essential information

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The emergency flashers are used to warn other drivers when the vehicle has to be stopped on the road due to a breakdown, etc.

title.title: Operating instructions

p_sub.p_sub: All the turn signal lights will flash.
To turn them off, press the switch once again.

title.title: Emergency flashers

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the emergency flashers are used for a long time while the engine is not operating, the battery may discharge.

indexmarker.marker: Engine switch:If your vehicle has to be stopped in an emergency
Ignition switch (engine switch):If your vehicle has to be stopped in an emergency
Engine:If your vehicle has to be stopped in an emergency
Emergency, in case of:If your vehicle has to be stopped in an emergency

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Only in an emergency, such as if it becomes impossible to stop the vehicle in the normal way, stop the vehicle using the following procedure:

title.title: Stopping the vehicle

steptxt.steptxt: Steadily step on the brake pedal with both feet and firmly depress it.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Do not pump the brake pedal repeatedly as this will increase the effort required to slow the vehicle.

steptxt.steptxt: Shift the shift lever to N.

title.title: If the shift lever is shifted to N

steptxt.steptxt: After slowing down, stop the vehicle in a safe place by the road.
Stop the engine.

title.title: If the shift lever cannot be shifted to N

steptxt.steptxt: Keep depressing the brake pedal with both feet to reduce vehicle speed as much as possible.
Vehicles without a smart entry & start system: Stop the engine by turning the engine switch to ACC.
Vehicles with a smart entry & start system: To stop the engine, press and hold the engine switch for 2 consecutive seconds or more, or press it briefly 3 times or more in succession.
Stop the vehicle in a safe place by the road.

title.title: If the engine has to be turned off while driving

itemtxt.itemtxt: Power assist for the brakes and steering wheel will be lost, making the brake pedal harder to depress and the steering wheel heavier to turn. Decelerate as much as possible before turning off the engine.
Vehicles without a smart entry & start system: Never attempt to remove the key, as doing so will lock the steering wheel.

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If the vehicle is trapped in rising water

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: In the event the vehicle is submerged in water, remain calm and perform the following.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Remove the seat belt first.
If the door can be opened, open the door and exit the vehicle.
If the door can not be opened, open the window using the power window switch and exit the vehicle through the window.

If the window can not be opened using the power window switch, remain calm, wait until the water level inside the vehicle rises to the point that the water pressure inside of the vehicle equals the water pressure outside of the vehicle, and then open the door and exit the vehicle.

p.p: Contact your Toyota dealer or aftermarket accessory manufacturer for further information about an emergency hammer.

title.title: Escaping the vehicle from the window
Steps to take in an emergency

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If your vehicle needs to be towed

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: If towing is necessary, we recommend having your vehicle towed by your Toyota dealer or commercial towing service, using a wheel-lift type truck or flatbed truck.
Use a safety chain system for all towing, and abide by all state/provincial and local laws.

title.title: When towing the vehicle

p.p: Be sure to transport the vehicle with the front wheels raised or with all four wheels raised off the ground. If the vehicle is towed with the front wheels contacting the ground, the drivetrain and related parts may be damaged.

title.title: While towing

itemtxt.itemtxt: When towing using cables or chains, avoid sudden starts, etc. which place excessive stress on the towing eyelets, cables or chains. The towing eyelets, cables or chains may become damaged, broken debris may hit people, and cause serious damage.

title.title: Installing towing eyelets to the vehicle
To prevent damage to the vehicle when towing using a wheel-lift type truck

itemtxt.itemtxt: Vehicles without smart entry & start system: Do not tow the vehicle from the rear when the engine switch is off or the key is removed. The steering lock mechanism is not strong enough to hold the front wheels straight.
Vehicles with smart entry & start system: Do not tow the vehicle from the rear when the engine switch is off. The steering lock mechanism is not strong enough to hold the front wheels straight.
When raising the vehicle, ensure adequate ground clearance for towing at the opposite end of the raised vehicle. Without adequate clearance, the vehicle could be damaged while being towed.

title.title: To prevent damage to the vehicle when towing with a sling-type truck

p.p: Do not tow with a sling-type truck, either from the front or rear.

title.title: To prevent damage to the vehicle during emergency towing

p.p: Do not secure cables or chains to the suspension components.

title.title: Situations when it is necessary to contact dealers before towing

p.p: The following may indicate a problem with your transmission. Contact your Toyota dealer or commercial towing service before towing.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The engine is running but the vehicle does not move.
The vehicle makes an abnormal sound.

title.title: Towing with a sling-type truck

p.p: Do not tow with a sling-type truck to prevent body damage.

title.title: Towing with a wheel-lift type truck
From the front
From the rear

p.p: Use a towing dolly under the front wheels.

title.title: Using a flatbed truck

p.p: If your vehicle is transported by a flatbed truck, it should be tied down at the locations shown in the illustration.
If you use chains or cables to tie down your vehicle, the angles shaded in black must be 45°.
Do not overly tighten the tie downs or the vehicle may be damaged.

title.title: Emergency towing

p.p: For vehicles with a continuously variable transmission, only the front towing eyelets may be used.

steptxt.steptxt: Remove the eyelet cover using a flathead screwdriver.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: To protect the bodywork, place a rag between the screwdriver and the vehicle body as shown in the illustration.

steptxt.steptxt: Insert the towing eyelet into the hole and tighten partially by hand.
Tighten down the towing eyelet securely using a wheel nut wrench or hard metal bar.
Securely attach cables or chains to the towing eyelet.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Take care not to damage the vehicle body.

steptxt.steptxt: Enter the vehicle being towed and start the engine.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If the engine does not start, turn the engine switch to ON.

title.title: While towing

p.p: If the engine is not running, the power assist for the brakes and steering will not function, making steering and braking more difficult.

title.title: Wheel nut wrench

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If you think something is wrong

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: If you notice any of the following symptoms, your vehicle probably needs adjustment or repair. Contact your Toyota dealer as soon as possible.

title.title: Visible symptoms

itemtxt.itemtxt: Flat-looking tires or uneven tire wear
Vehicles with a drive monitor display: High engine coolant temperature warning light comes on.
Vehicles with a multi-information display: Engine coolant temperature gauge needle continually points higher than normal.

title.title: Audible symptoms

itemtxt.itemtxt: Changes in exhaust sound
Excessive tire squeal when cornering
Strange noises related to the suspension system
Pinging or other noises related to the engine

title.title: Operational symptoms

itemtxt.itemtxt: Engine missing, stumbling or running roughly
Appreciable loss of power
Vehicle pulls heavily to one side when braking
Vehicle pulls heavily to one side when driving on a level road
Loss of brake effectiveness, spongy feeling, pedal almost touches the floor

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: To minimize the risk of fuel leakage when the engine stalls or when an airbag inflates upon collision, the fuel pump shut off system stops the supply of fuel to the engine.

title.title: Restarting the engine

p.p: Follow the procedure below to restart the engine after the system is activated.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn the engine switch to ACC or OFF.
Restart the engine.

title.title: Before starting the engine

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If a warning light turns on
Emergency, in case of:If a warning buzzer sounds

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Calmly perform the following actions if any of the warning lights comes on or flashes. If a light comes on or flashes, but then goes off, this does not necessarily indicate a malfunction in the system. However, if this continues to occur, have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

title.title: Actions to the warning lights or warning buzzers

itemtxt.itemtxt: The brake fluid level is low; or
The brake system is malfunctioning

resulttxt.resulttxt: Immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place and contact your Toyota dealer. Continuing to drive the vehicle may be dangerous.

title.title: Brake system warning light

p.p: Indicates a malfunction in the parking brake system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: Indicates that the engine coolant temperature is excessively high
Vehicles with a multi-information display: This light illuminates on the multi-information display.
Indicates a malfunction in the vehicle’s charging system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place and contact your Toyota dealer.

p.p: Indicates that the engine oil pressure is excessively low

resulttxt.resulttxt: Immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place and contact your Toyota dealer.

p.p: Vehicles with a multi-information display: This light illuminates on the multi-information display.
Indicates that the engine oil level is low
This warning light may come on if the vehicle is stopped on a slope. Move the vehicle to a level surface and check to see if the light goes off.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Check the level of the engine oil, and add if necessary.

indexmarker.marker: Warning lights:Continuously variable transmission fluid temperature

p.p: Indicates that the continuously variable transmission fluid temperature is excessively high

resulttxt.resulttxt: Immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place and contact your Toyota dealer.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The electronic engine control system;
The electronic throttle control system; or
The electronic continuously variable transmission (if equipped) control system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place and contact your Toyota dealer.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The SRS airbag system; or
The seat belt pretensioner system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The ABS; or
The brake assist system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Vehicles with a drive monitor display

p.p: When the warning light comes on:

itemtxt.itemtxt: The Brake Override System; or
The Drive-Start Control (if equipped)

resulttxt.resulttxt: Release the accelerator pedal and depress the brake pedal.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The Brake Override System; or
The Drive-Start Control (if equipped)

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Vehicles with a multi-information display
The Brake Override System; or
The Drive-Start Control (if equipped)

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: Indicates that the shift position was changed and Drive-Start Control (if equipped) was operated while depressing the accelerator pedal.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Momentarily release the accelerator pedal.

p.p: When a buzzer does not sound:
Indicates that the accelerator and brake pedals are being depressed simultaneously, and the Brake Override System is operating.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Release the accelerator pedal and depress the brake pedal.

p.p: Vehicles with a multi-information display: This light illuminates on the multi-information display.

indexmarker.marker: Power steering (Electric power steering system):Warning light

p.p: Indicates a malfunction in the EPS (Electric Power Steering) system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: Indicates a malfunction in the smart entry & start system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: Indicates that a door or the trunk is not fully closed.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Check that all the doors and the trunk are closed.

p_sub.p_sub: The open door warning buzzer sounds to alert one or more of the doors or trunk is not fully closed (with the vehicle having reached a speed of 5 km/h [3 mph]).

p.p: Indicates that remaining fuel is approximately 7.5 L (2 gal., 1.6 Imp. gal.) or less

resulttxt.resulttxt: Refuel the vehicle.

p.p: Indicates that your vehicle speed reaches or exceeds 120 km/h (75 mph).

resulttxt.resulttxt: Reduce the speed.

p.p: The buzzer will stop sounding after 6 seconds or if you decelerate to below 120 km/h (75 mph).
Warns the driver and/or front passenger to fasten their seat belts
Driver’s and front passenger’s seat belt warning buzzer:

p_sub.p_sub: The driver's and front passenger's seat belt warning buzzer sounds to alert the driver and front passenger that his or her seat belt is not fastened. If the seat belt is unfastened, the buzzer sounds intermittently for a certain period of time after the vehicle reaches a certain speed.

p.p: Warns the rear passengers to fasten their seat belts

resulttxt.resulttxt: Fasten the seat belt.

p.p: Rear passengers’ seat belt warning buzzer:

p_sub.p_sub: The rear passengers' seat belt warning buzzer sounds to alert the rear passenger that his or her seat belt is not fastened. If the seat belt is unfastened, the buzzer sounds intermittenly for a certain period of time, after the seat belt is fastened and unfastened and the vehicle reaches a certain speed.

p.p: When the light comes on after blinking for approximately 1 minute:
Malfunction in the tire pressure warning system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the system checked by your Toyota dealer.

p.p: Low tire inflation pressure such as

itemtxt.itemtxt: Natural causes
Flat tire

indexmarker.marker: Warning buzzers:LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control)

p.p: Indicates a malfunction in the LTA (Lane Tracing Assist) or LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control)

indexmarker.marker: Warning lights:Toyota parking assist-sensor OFF indicator

p.p: Indicates a malfunction in the Toyota parking assist-sensor function

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: Indicates that the system is temporarily unavailable, possibly due to a sensor being dirty or covered with ice, etc.
Indicates a malfunction in the RCTA (Rear Cross Traffic Alert) function

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: Indicates a malfunction has occurred in the PCS (Pre-Collision System).

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: When a buzzer does not sound:
The PCS (Pre-Collision System) has become temporarily unavailable, corrective action may be necessary.
If the PCS (Pre-Collision System) or VSC (Vehicle Stability Control) system is disabled, the PCS warning light will illuminate.
Indicates a malfunction in the cruise control system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The VSC system;
The TRC system; or
The hill-start assist control system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

p.p: It is possible that the parking brake is not fully engaged or released

resulttxt.resulttxt: Operate the parking brake once again.

p.p: This light comes on when the parking brake is not released. If the light turns off after the parking brake is fully released, the system is operating normally.
Indicates a malfunction in the brake hold system

resulttxt.resulttxt: Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

title.title: Warning buzzer

p.p: In some cases, the buzzer may not be heard due to being in a noisy location or audio sound.

title.title: Front passenger detection sensor, seat belt reminder and warning buzzer

itemtxt.itemtxt: If luggage is placed on the front passenger seat, the front passenger detection sensor may cause the warning light to flash and the warning buzzer to sound even if a passenger is not sitting in the seat.
If a cushion is placed on the seat, the sensor may not detect a passenger, and the warning light may not operate properly.

title.title: If the malfunction indicator lamp comes on while driving

p.p: For some models, the malfunction indicator lamp will come on if the fuel tank becomes completely empty. If the fuel tank is empty, refuel the vehicle immediately. The malfunction indicator lamp will go off after several trips.
If the malfunction indicator lamp does not go off, contact your Toyota dealer as soon as possible.

title.title: Electric power steering system warning light (warning buzzer)

p.p: When the battery charge becomes insufficient or the voltage temporarily drops, the electric power steering system warning light may come on and the warning buzzer may sound.

title.title: When the tire pressure warning light comes on (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: Inspect the tires to check if a tire is punctured.

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the tire pressure warning light blinks for approximately 1 minute then stays on
There may be a malfunction in the tire pressure warning system. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.
If the tire pressure warning light comes on

steptxt.steptxt: After the temperature of the tires has lowered sufficiently, check the inflation pressure of each tire and adjust them to the specified level.

title.title: The tire pressure warning light may come on due to natural causes (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: The tire pressure warning light may come on due to natural causes such as natural air leaks and tire inflation pressure changes caused by temperature. In this case, adjusting the tire inflation pressure will turn off the warning light (after a few minutes).

title.title: When a tire is replaced with a spare tire (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: Vehicles with a compact spare tire: The compact spare tire is not equipped with a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter. If a tire goes flat, the tire pressure warning light will not turn off even though the flat tire has been replaced with the spare tire. Replace the spare tire with the repaired tire and adjust the tire inflation pressure. The tire pressure warning light will go off after a few minutes.

Vehicles with a full-size spare tire: The spare tire is also equipped with a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter. The tire pressure warning light will turn on if the tire inflation pressure of the spare tire is low. If a tire goes flat, the tire pressure warning light will not turn off even though the flat tire has been replaced with the spare tire. Replace the spare tire with the repaired tire and adjust the tire inflation pressure. The tire pressure warning light will go off after a few minutes.

title.title: Conditions that the tire pressure warning system may not function properly (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)
If both the ABS and the brake system warning lights remain on
When the electric power steering system warning light comes on
If the tire pressure warning light comes on (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

itemtxt.itemtxt: Stop your vehicle in a safe place as soon as possible. Adjust the tire inflation pressure immediately.

Vehicles with a compact spare tire: If the tire pressure warning light comes on even after tire inflation pressure adjustment, it is probable that you have a flat tire. Check the tires. If a tire is flat, change it with the spare tire and have the flat tire repaired by the nearest Toyota dealer.

Vehicles with emergency tire puncture repair kit: If the tire pressure warning light comes on even after tire inflation pressure adjustment, it is probable that you have a flat tire. Check the tires. If a tire is flat, repair the flat tire by using emergency tire puncture repair kit.

title.title: If a blowout or sudden air leakage should occur (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: The tire pressure warning system may not activate immediately.

title.title: To ensure the tire pressure warning system operates properly (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: Do not install tires with different specifications or makers, as the tire pressure warning system may not operate properly.

title.title: Follow the correction procedures. (vehicles with a smart entry & start system and with a drive monitor display)

p.p: After taking the specified steps to correct the suspected problem, check that the warning light turns off.
The electronic key was carried outside the vehicle and the driver’s door was opened and closed while any shift position other than P was selected without turning off the engine switch.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Change the shift position to P.
Bring the electronic key back into the vehicle.

p.p: The electronic key was carried outside the vehicle and the driver’s door was opened and closed while the shift position P was selected without turning off the engine switch.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Turn the engine switch off or bring the electronic key back into the vehicle.

p.p: Indicates that a door other than the driver’s door has been opened and closed with the engine switch in any mode other than off and the electronic key outside of the detection area.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Confirm the location of the electronic key.

p.p: An attempt was made to exit the vehicle with the electronic key and lock the doors without first turning the engine switch off.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Turn the engine switch off and lock the doors again.

p.p: Indicates that the electronic key is not present when attempting to start the engine.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Confirm the location of the electronic key.

p.p: An attempt was made to drive when the regular key was not inside the vehicle.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Confirm that the electronic key is inside the vehicle.

p.p: Indicates that the electronic key battery is low.
Indicates that the steering lock has not been released.

itemtxt.itemtxt: When the doors were unlocked with the mechanical key and then the engine switch was pressed, the electronic key could not be detected in the vehicle.
The electronic key could not be detected in the vehicle even after the engine switch was pressed two consecutive times.

resulttxt.resulttxt: Touch the electronic key to the engine switch while depressing the brake pedal.

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If a warning message is displayed

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The multi-information display shows warnings for system malfunctions and incorrectly performed operations, and messages that indicate a need for maintenance. When a message is displayed, perform the appropriate corrective action for the message.
If a warning message is displayed again after the appropriate actions have been performed, contact your Toyota dealer.

title.title: Warning messages

p.p: The warning messages explained below may differ from the actual messages according to operation conditions and vehicle specifications.

title.title: Warning buzzer
If “Engine Oil Level Low Add or Replace” is displayed

p.p: The engine oil level is low. Check the level of the engine oil, and add if necessary.
This message may appear if the vehicle is stopped on a slope. Move the vehicle to a level surface and check to see if the message disappears.

title.title: If “Engine Stopped Steering Power Low” is displayed

p.p: This message is displayed if the engine is stopped while driving.
When steering wheel operations are heavier than usual, grip the steering wheel firmly and operate it using more force than usual.

title.title: If “Auto Power OFF to Conserve Battery” is displayed

p.p: Power was cut off due to the automatic power off function. Next time when starting the engine, increase the engine speed slightly and maintain that level for approximately 5 minutes to recharge the battery.

title.title: If “Headlight System Malfunction Visit Your Dealer” is displayed

p.p: The following systems may be malfunctioning. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The LED headlight system (if equipped)
Automatic High Beam (if equipped)

title.title: If “Front Camera Unavailable” or “Front Camera Temporarily Unavailable See Owner’s Manual” is displayed

itemtxt.itemtxt: PCS (Pre-Collision system) (if equipped)
LTA (Lane Tracing Assist) (if equipped)
LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped)
Automatic High Beam (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control with full-speed range (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control (if equipped)

title.title: If “Radar Cruise Control Temporarily Unavailable See Owner's Manual” is displayed (if equipped)
If “Radar Cruise Control Unavailable” is displayed (if equipped)

p.p: The dynamic radar cruise control system cannot be used temporarily. Use the system when it becomes available again.

title.title: If “Speed Limit Exceeded” is displayed (if equipped)
If a message that indicates the need for visiting your Toyota dealer is displayed

p.p: The system or part shown on the multi-information display is malfunctioning. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.

title.title: If a message that indicates the need for referring to Owner’s Manual is displayed

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the following message is displayed on the multi-information display, it may indicate a malfunction. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately.
“Smart Entry & Start System Malfunction”
If any of the following messages are displayed on the multi-information display, it may indicate a malfunction. Immediately stop the vehicle and contact your Toyota dealer.
“Braking Power Low”
“Charging System Malfunction”
“Oil Pressure Low”

title.title: If “High Power Consumption Partial Limit on AC/Heater Operation” is displayed frequently

p.p: There is a possible malfunction relating to the charging system or the battery may be deteriorating. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If you have a flat tire
Tires:If you have a flat tire
Flat tire:Vehicles without a spare tire

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Your vehicle is not equipped with a spare tire, but instead is equipped with an emergency tire puncture repair kit.

A puncture caused by a nail or screw passing through the tire tread can be repaired temporarily using the emergency tire puncture repair kit. (The kit contains a bottle of sealant. The sealant can be used only once to temporarily repair one tire without removing the nail or screw from the tire.) After temporarily repairing the tire with the kit, have the tire repaired or replaced by your Toyota dealer.

title.title: If you have a flat tire
Before repairing the tire

itemtxt.itemtxt: Stop the vehicle in a safe place on a hard, flat surface.
Set the parking brake.
Shift the shift lever to P.
Stop the engine.
Turn on the emergency flashers.
Check the degree of the tire damage.

p.p: A tire should only be repaired with the emergency tire puncture repair kit if the damage is caused by a nail or screw passing through the tire tread.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not remove the nail or screw from the tire. Removing the object may widen the opening and make emergency repair with the repair kit impossible.
To avoid sealant leakage, move the vehicle until the area of the puncture, if known, is positioned at the top of the tire.

title.title: A flat tire that cannot be repaired with the emergency tire puncture repair kit

p.p: In the following cases, the tire cannot be repaired with the emergency tire puncture repair kit. Contact your Toyota dealer.

itemtxt.itemtxt: When the tire is damaged due to driving without sufficient air pressure
When there are any cracks or damage at any location on the tire, such as on the side wall, except the tread
When the tire is visibly separated from the wheel
When the cut or damage to the tread is 4 mm (0.16 in.) long or more
When the wheel is damaged
When two or more tires have been punctured
When more than 2 sharp objects such as nails or screws have passed through the tread on a single tire
When the sealant has expired

title.title: Emergency tire puncture repair kit components
Bottle
Compressor
Note for checking the emergency tire puncture repair kit
Emergency tire puncture repair kit

itemtxt.itemtxt: The emergency tire puncture repair kit is for filling the car tire with air.
The sealant has a limited life span. The expiry date is marked on the bottle. The sealant should be replaced before the expiry date. Contact your Toyota dealer for replacement.

The sealant stored in the emergency tire puncture repair kit can be used only once to temporarily repair a single tire. If the sealant in the bottle and other parts of the kit have been used and need to be replaced, contact your Toyota dealer.
The compressor can be used repeatedly.
The sealant can be used when the outside temperature is from -30°C (-22°F) to 60°C (140°F).
The kit is exclusively designed for size and type of tires originally installed on your vehicle. Do not use it for tires that a different size than the original ones, or for any other purposes.
If the sealant gets on your clothes, it may stain.
If the sealant adheres to a wheel or the surface of the vehicle body, the stain may not be removable if it is not cleaned at once. Immediately wipe away the sealant with a wet cloth.
During operation of the repair kit, a loud operation noise is produced. This does not indicate a malfunction.
Do not use to check or to adjust the tire pressure.

title.title: Caution while driving

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not use repair kit for tires that are different size than the original ones, or for any other purpose. If the tires have not been completely repaired, it could lead to an accident causing death or serious injury.

title.title: Precautions for use of the sealant

itemtxt.itemtxt: Ingesting the sealant is hazardous to your health. If you ingest sealant, consume as much water as possible, and then immediately consult a doctor.
If sealant gets in eyes or adheres to skin, immediately wash it off with water. If discomfort persists, consult a doctor.

title.title: Taking out the emergency tire puncture repair kit

steptxt.steptxt: Remove the deck mat.

title.title: Emergency repair method

steptxt.steptxt: Take out the repair kit from the plastic bag.
Pull out the hose and power plug from the bottom side of the compressor.
Connect the bottle to the compressor.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Make sure to press the bottle until its claws are securely engaged to the compressor and no longer visible.

steptxt.steptxt: Connect the hose to the bottle.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Make sure to insert the hose until its claw is securely engaged to the bottle.

steptxt.steptxt: Remove the valve cap from the valve of the punctured tire.
Extend the hose. Remove the air release cap from the hose.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: You will use the air release cap again. Therefore keep it in a safe place.

steptxt.steptxt: Connect the hose to the valve.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Screw the end of the hose clockwise as far as possible.

steptxt.steptxt: Make sure that the compressor switch is off.
Attach the sticker provided with the tire puncture repair kit to a position easily seen from the driver’s seat.
Check the specified tire inflation pressure.
To inject the sealant and inflate the tire, turn the compressor switch on.
Inflate the tire until the specified air pressure is reached.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Turn the compressor switch off and then check the tire inflation pressure. Being careful not to over inflate, check and repeat the inflation procedure until the specified tire inflation pressure is reached.

The tire can be inflated for about 5 to 20 minutes (depending on the outside temperature). If the tire inflation pressure is still lower than the specified point after inflation for 25 minutes, the tire is too damaged to be repaired. Turn the compressor switch off and contact your Toyota dealer.

steptxt.steptxt: With the compressor switch off, disconnect the hose from the valve on the tire and then pull out the power plug from the power outlet socket.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Some sealant may leak when the hose is removed.

steptxt.steptxt: Install the valve cap onto the valve of the emergency repaired tire.
Attach the air release cap to the end of the hose.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If the air release cap is not attached, the sealant may leak and the vehicle may get dirty.

steptxt.steptxt: Temporarily store the bottle in the trunk while it is connected to the compressor.
To spread the liquid sealant evenly within the tire, immediately drive safely for about 5 km (3 miles) below 80 km/h (50 mph).
After driving, stop your vehicle in a safe place on a hard, flat surface and reconnect the repair kit.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Remove the air release cap from the hose before reconnecting the hose.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn the compressor switch on and wait for several seconds, then turn it off. Check the tire inflation pressure.
Attach the air release cap to the end of the hose.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If the air release cap is not attached, the sealant may leak and the vehicle may get dirty.

steptxt.steptxt: Store the bottle in the trunk while it is connected to the compressor.

Taking precautions to avoid sudden braking, sudden acceleration and sharp turns, drive carefully at under 80 km/h (50 mph) to the nearest Toyota dealer that is less than 100 km (62 miles) away for tire repair or replacement.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: When having the tire repaired or replaced, make sure to tell the Toyota dealer that the sealant is injected.

title.title: If the tire is inflated to more than the specified air pressure

steptxt.steptxt: Disconnect the hose from the valve.
Install the air release cap to the end of the hose and push the protrusion on the air release cap into the tire valve to let some air out.
Disconnect the hose from the valve, remove the air release cap from the hose and then reconnect the hose.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If the air pressure is under the designated pressure, turn the compressor switch on again and repeat the inflation procedure until the specified air pressure is reached.

title.title: The valve of a tire that has been repaired

p.p: After a tire is repaired with the emergency tire puncture repair kit, the valve should be replaced.

title.title: After a tire is repaired with the emergency tire puncture repair kit

itemtxt.itemtxt: The tire pressure warning valve and transmitter should be replaced.
Even if the tire inflation pressure is at the recommended level, the tire pressure warning light may come on/flash.

title.title: Do not drive the vehicle with a flat tire

p.p: Driving with a flat tire may cause a circumferential groove on the side wall. In such a case, the tire may explode when using a repair kit.

title.title: When fixing the flat tire

itemtxt.itemtxt: Stop your vehicle in a safe and flat area.
Connect the valve and hose securely with the tire installed on the vehicle. If the hose is not properly connected to the valve, air leakage may occur as sealant may be sprayed out.
If the hose comes off the valve while inflating the tire, there is a risk that the hose will move abruptly due to air pressure.
After inflation of the tire has completed, the sealant may splatter when the hose is disconnected or some air is let out of the tire.
Follow the operation procedure to repair the tire. If the procedures not followed, the sealant may spray out.

Keep back from the tire while it is being repaired, as there is a chance of it bursting while the repair operation is being performed. If you notice any cracks or deformation of the tire, turn off the compressor switch and stop the repair operation immediately.
The repair kit may overheat if operated for a long period of time. Do not operate the repair kit continuously for more than 40 minutes.

Parts of the repair kit become hot during operation. Be careful handling the repair kit during and after operation. Do not touch the metal part connecting the bottle and the compressor. It will be extremely hot.

Do not attach the vehicle speed warning sticker to an area other than the one indicated. If the sticker is attached to an area where an SRS airbag is located, such as the pad of the steering wheel, it may prevent the SRS airbag from operating properly.

title.title: Driving to spread the liquid sealant evenly

itemtxt.itemtxt: Drive the vehicle carefully at a low speed. Be especially careful when turning and cornering.
If the vehicle does not drive straight or you feel a pull through the steering wheel, stop the vehicle and check the following.
Tire condition. The tire may have separated from the wheel.

title.title: When performing an emergency repair

itemtxt.itemtxt: The repair kit is not waterproof. Make sure that the repair kit is not exposed to water, such as when it is being used in the rain.
Do not put the repair kit directly onto dusty ground such as sand at the side of the road. If the repair kit vacuums up dust etc., a malfunction may occur.
Make sure to stand the kit with the bottle vertical. The kit cannot work properly if it is laid on its side.

title.title: Precautions for the emergency tire puncture repair kit

itemtxt.itemtxt: The repair kit power source should be 12 V DC suitable for vehicle use. Do not connect the repair kit to any other source.
If fuel splatters on the repair kit, the repair kit may deteriorate. Take care not to allow fuel to contact it.
Place the repair kit in a storage to prevent it from being exposed to dirt or water.
Store the repair kit in the trunk out of reach of children.
Do not disassemble or modify the repair kit. Do not subject parts such as the air pressure indicator to impacts. This may cause a malfunction.

title.title: To avoid damage to the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If you have a flat tire
Flat tire:Vehicles with a spare tire
Tires:If you have a flat tire

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Your vehicle is equipped with a spare tire. The flat tire can be replaced with the spare tire.

title.title: If you have a flat tire

p.p: Do not continue driving with a flat tire. Driving even a short distance with a flat tire can damage the tire and the wheel beyond repair, which could result in an accident.

title.title: Before jacking up the vehicle

itemtxt.itemtxt: Stop the vehicle in a safe place on a hard, flat surface.
Set the parking brake.
Shift the shift lever to P (continuously variable transmission) or R (manual transmission).
Stop the engine.
Turn on the emergency flashers.
Vehicles with a compact spare tire
Vehicles with a full-size spare tire

title.title: Using the tire jack

p.p: Observe the following precautions. Improper use of the tire jack may cause the vehicle to suddenly fall off the jack, leading to death or serious injury.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not use the tire jack for any purpose other than replacing tires or installing and removing tire chains.
Only use the tire jack that comes with this vehicle for replacing a flat tire. Do not use it on other vehicles, and do not use other tire jacks for replacing tires on this vehicle.
Put the jack properly in its jack point.
Do not put any part of your body under the vehicle while it is supported by the jack.
Do not start the engine or drive the vehicle while the vehicle is supported by the jack.
Do not raise the vehicle while someone is inside.
When raising the vehicle, do not put an object on or under the jack.
Do not raise the vehicle to a height greater than that required to replace the tire.
Use a jack stand if it is necessary to get under the vehicle.
When lowering the vehicle, make sure that there is no-one near the vehicle. If there are people nearby, warn them vocally before lowering.

title.title: Taking out the jack

steptxt.steptxt: Remove the deck mat.
Take out the jack.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Vehicles with a compact spare tire:
Vehicles with a full-size spare tire:

title.title: Taking out the spare tire

steptxt.steptxt: Remove the tool tray.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Vehicles with a compact spare tire:
Vehicles with a full-size spare tire:

steptxt.steptxt: Loosen the center fastener that secures the spare tire.

title.title: When storing the spare tire

p.p: Be careful not to catch fingers or other body parts between the spare tire and the body of the vehicle.

title.title: Replacing a flat tire

steptxt.steptxt: Chock the tires.

p.p: Behind the rear right-hand side tire
Behind the rear left-hand side tire
In front of the front right-hand side tire
In front of the front left-hand side tire

steptxt.steptxt: Vehicles with a steel wheel: Remove the wheel ornament using the wrench.
Slightly loosen the wheel nuts (one turn).
Assemble the jack handle extension.
Raise the vehicle until the tire is slightly raised off the ground.
Remove all the wheel nuts and the tire.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: When resting the tire on the ground, place the tire so that the wheel design faces up to avoid scratching the wheel surface.

title.title: Replacing a flat tire

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not touch the disc wheels or the area around the brakes immediately after the vehicle has been driven. After the vehicle has been driven the disc wheels and the area around the brakes will be extremely hot. Touching these areas with hands, feet or other body parts while changing a tire, etc. may result in burns.
Failure to follow these precautions could cause the wheel nuts to loosen and the tire to fall off, resulting in death or serious injury.
Have the wheel nuts tightened with a torque wrench to 103 N•m (10.5 kgf•m, 76 ft•lbf) as soon as possible after changing wheels.
Do not attach a heavily damaged wheel ornament, as it may fly off the wheel while the vehicle is moving.
When installing a tire, only use wheel nuts that have been specifically designed for that wheel.
If there are any cracks or deformations in the bolt screws, nut threads or bolt holes of the wheel, have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

title.title: Installing the spare tire

steptxt.steptxt: Remove any dirt or foreign matter from the wheel contact surface.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If foreign matter is on the wheel contact surface, the wheel nuts may loosen while the vehicle is in motion, causing the tire to come off.

steptxt.steptxt: Install the tire and loosely tighten each wheel nut by hand by approximately the same amount.
Lower the vehicle.
Firmly tighten each wheel nut two or three times in the order shown in the illustration.
Vehicles with a full-size spare tire and a steel wheel: Reinstall the wheel ornament.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Align the cutout of the wheel ornament with the valve stem as shown in the illustration.

steptxt.steptxt: Stow the flat tire, tire jack and all tools.

title.title: The full-size spare tire
The compact spare tire

itemtxt.itemtxt: The compact spare tire is identified by the label “TEMPORARY USE ONLY” on the tire sidewall. Use the compact spare tire temporarily, and only in an emergency.

title.title: When the compact spare tire is equipped

p.p: The vehicle becomes lower when driving with the compact spare tire compared to when driving with standard tires.

title.title: After completing the tire change (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)
When using the compact spare tire (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: As the compact spare tire is not equipped with a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter, low inflation pressure of the spare tire will not be indicated by the tire pressure warning system. Also, if you replace the spare tire after the tire pressure warning light comes on, the light remains on.

title.title: If you have a flat front tire on a road covered with snow or ice

p.p: Install the compact spare tire on one of the rear wheels of the vehicle. Perform the following steps and fit tire chains to the front tires:

steptxt.steptxt: Replace a rear tire with the compact spare tire.
Replace the flat front tire with the tire removed from the rear of the vehicle.
Fit tire chains to the front tires.

title.title: When using the full-size spare tire

itemtxt.itemtxt: Replace the full-size spare tire with a standard tire as soon as possible.
Avoid sudden acceleration, abrupt steering, sudden braking and shifting operations that cause sudden engine braking.

title.title: When using the compact spare tire

itemtxt.itemtxt: Remember that the compact spare tire provided is specifically designed for use with your vehicle. Do not use your compact spare tire on another vehicle.
Do not use more than one compact spare tires simultaneously.
Replace the compact spare tire with a standard tire as soon as possible.
Avoid sudden acceleration, abrupt steering, sudden braking and shifting operations that cause sudden engine braking.

title.title: When the compact spare tire is attached

p.p: The vehicle speed may not be correctly detected, and the following systems may not operate correctly:

itemtxt.itemtxt: ABS & Brake assist
VSC
TRC
Automatic High Beam (if equipped)
Cruise control (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control with full-speed range (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control (if equipped)
EPS
PCS (Pre-Collision System) (if equipped)
LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped)
LTA (Lane Tracing Assist) (if equipped)
Tire pressure warning system (if equipped)
Toyota parking assist-sensor (if equipped)
BSM (Blind Spot Monitor) (if equipped)
Rear view monitor system (if equipped)
Navigation system (if equipped)

title.title: Speed limit when using the compact spare tire

p.p: Do not drive at speeds in excess of 80 km/h (50 mph) when a compact spare tire is installed on the vehicle.
The compact spare tire is not designed for driving at high speeds. Failure to observe this precaution may lead to an accident causing death or serious injury.

title.title: After using the tools and jack

p.p: Before driving, make sure all the tools and jack are securely in place in their storage location to reduce the possibility of personal injury during a collision or sudden braking.

title.title: Be careful when driving over bumps with the compact spare tire installed on the vehicle.

p.p: The vehicle becomes lower when driving with the compact spare tire compared to when driving with standard tires. Be careful when driving over uneven road surfaces.

title.title: Driving with tire chains and the compact spare tire

p.p: Do not fit tire chains to the compact spare tire. Tire chains may damage the vehicle body and adversely affect driving performance.

title.title: When replacing the tires (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

p.p: When removing or fitting the wheels, tires or the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter, contact your Toyota dealer as the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter may be damaged if not handled correctly.

title.title: To avoid damage to the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If the engine will not start
Engine:If the engine will not start

title.title: The engine will not start even though the starter motor operates normally.

p.p: One of the following may be the cause of the problem:

itemtxt.itemtxt: There may not be sufficient fuel in the vehicle’s tank. Refuel the vehicle.

title.title: The starter motor turns over slowly, the interior lights and headlights are dim, or the horn does not sound or sounds at a low volume.

p.p: One of the following may be the cause of the problem:

title.title: The starter motor does not turn over (vehicles with a smart entry & start system)
The starter motor does not turn over, the interior lights and headlights do not turn on, or the horn does not sound.

p.p: One of the following may be the cause of the problem:

itemtxt.itemtxt: There may be a malfunction in the steering lock system.

p_sub.p_sub: Contact your Toyota dealer if the problem cannot be repaired, or if repair procedures are unknown.

title.title: Emergency start function (vehicles with a smart entry & start system)

steptxt.steptxt: Check that the shift lever is in P.
Turn the engine switch to ACC.
Press and hold the engine switch for about 15 seconds while depressing the brake pedal firmly.

p_sub.p_sub: Even if the engine can be started using the above steps, the system may be malfunctioning. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If you lose your keys

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: New genuine keys can be made by your Toyota dealer using the other key (vehicles without a smart entry & start system) or mechanical key (vehicles with a smart entry & start system) and the key number stamped on your key number plate.
Keep the plate in a safe place such as your wallet, not in the vehicle.

title.title: When an electronic key is lost (vehicles with a smart entry & start system)

p.p: If the electronic key remains lost, the risk of vehicle theft increases significantly. Visit your Toyota dealer immediately with all remaining electronic keys that were provided with your vehicle.

indexmarker.marker: Keys:If the electronic key does not operate properly
Electronic key:If the electronic key does not operate properly
Emergency, in case of:If the electronic key does not operate properly

title.title: When the electronic key does not work properly
In case of a smart entry & start system malfunction or other key-related problems

p.p: Take your vehicle with all the electronic keys provided with your vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

title.title: Locking and unlocking the doors
Key linked functions

p.p: This setting must be customized at your Toyota dealer.

title.title: When using the mechanical key and operating the power windows or moon roof (if equipped)
Starting the engine

steptxt.steptxt: Ensure that the shift lever is in P and depress the brake pedal.
Touch the Toyota emblem side of the electronic key to the engine switch.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: When the electronic key is detected, a buzzer sounds and the engine switch will turn to ON.
When the smart entry & start system is deactivated in customization setting, the engine switch will turn to ACC.

steptxt.steptxt: Press the engine switch shortly and firmly.

p.p: In the event that the engine still cannot be started, contact your Toyota dealer.

title.title: Stopping the engine

p.p: Shift the shift lever to P and press the engine switch as you normally do when stopping the engine.

title.title: Electronic key battery
Changing engine switch modes

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If the battery is discharged

title.title: Restarting the engine

p.p: If you have a set of jumper (or booster) cables and a second vehicle with a 12-volt battery, you can jump start your vehicle by following the steps below.

itemtxt.itemtxt: 1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE, 1ZR-FBE, 2ZR-FE and 2ZR-FBE engines
M20A-FKS engine

steptxt.steptxt: Start the engine of the second vehicle. Increase the engine speed slightly and maintain at that level for approximately 5 minutes to recharge the battery of your vehicle.
Vehicles with a smart entry & start system: Open and close any of the doors of your vehicle with the engine switch OFF.
Maintain the engine speed of the second vehicle and start the engine of your vehicle by turning the engine switch to ON.
Once the vehicle’s engine has started, remove the jumper cables in the exact reverse order from which they were connected.

p.p: Once the engine starts, have the vehicle inspected at your Toyota dealer as soon as possible.

title.title: Starting the engine when the battery is discharged

p.p: The engine cannot be started by push-starting.

title.title: To prevent battery discharge

itemtxt.itemtxt: Turn off the headlights and the audio system while the engine is off.
Turn off any unnecessary electrical components when the vehicle is running at a low speed for an extended period, such as in heavy traffic.

title.title: When the battery is removed or discharged

itemtxt.itemtxt: Information stored in the ECU is cleared. When the battery is depleted, have the vehicle inspected at your Toyota dealer.

title.title: When removing the battery terminals

p.p: When the battery terminals are removed, the information stored in the ECU is cleared. Before removing the battery terminals, contact your Toyota dealer.

title.title: Charging the battery

p.p: The electricity stored in the battery will discharge gradually even when the vehicle is not in use, due to natural discharge and the draining effects of certain electrical appliances. If the vehicle is left for a long time, the battery may discharge, and the engine may be unable to start. (The battery recharges automatically during driving.)

title.title: When recharging or replacing the battery (vehicles with a smart entry & start system)

itemtxt.itemtxt: In some cases, it may not be possible to unlock the doors using the smart entry & start system when the battery is discharged. Use the wireless remote control or the mechanical key to lock or unlock the doors.
The engine may not start on the first attempt after the battery has recharged but will start normally after the second attempt. This is not a malfunction.

title.title: When replacing the battery

itemtxt.itemtxt: Use a battery that conforms to European regulations.
Use a battery with the same case size as the previous battery and an equivalent 20 hour rate capacity (20HR) or greater.
If the sizes differ, the battery cannot be properly secured.
If the 20 hour rate capacity is low, even if the time period where the vehicle is not used is a short time, the battery may discharge and the engine may not be able to start.
For details, consult your Toyota dealer.

title.title: When removing the battery terminals

p.p: Always remove the negative (-) terminal first. If the positive (+) terminal contacts any metal in the surrounding area when the positive (+) terminal is removed, a spark may occur, leading to a fire in addition to electrical shocks and death or serious injury.

title.title: Avoiding battery fires or explosions

p.p: Observe the following precautions to prevent accidentally igniting the flammable gas that may be emitted from the battery:

itemtxt.itemtxt: Make sure each jumper cable is connected to the correct terminal and that it is not unintentionally in contact with any other than the intended terminal.
Do not allow the other end of the jumper cable connected to the “+” terminal to come into contact with any other parts or metal surfaces in the area, such as brackets or unpainted metal.
Do not allow the + and - clamps of the jumper cables to come into contact with each other.
Do not smoke, use matches, cigarette lighters or allow open flame near the battery.

p.p: The battery contains poisonous and corrosive acidic electrolyte, while related parts contain lead and lead compounds. Observe the following precautions when handling the battery:

itemtxt.itemtxt: When working with the battery, always wear safety glasses and take care not to allow any battery fluids (acid) to come into contact with skin, clothing or the vehicle body.
Do not lean over the battery.

In the event that battery fluid comes into contact with the skin or eyes, immediately wash the affected area with water and seek medical attention. Place a wet sponge or cloth over the affected area until medical attention can be received.
Always wash your hands after handling the battery support, terminals, and other battery-related parts.
Do not allow children near the battery.

title.title: When handling jumper cables

p.p: When connecting the jumper cables, ensure that they do not become entangled in the cooling fans or engine drive belt.

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If your vehicle overheats

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The following may indicate that your vehicle is overheating.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Vehicles with a multi-information display:  “Engine Coolant Temp High Stop in a Safe Place See Owner’s Manual” is shown on the multi-information display.
Steam comes out from under the hood.

title.title: Correction procedures

steptxt.steptxt: Stop the vehicle in a safe place and turn off the air conditioning system, and then stop the engine.
After the engine has cooled down sufficiently, inspect the hoses and radiator core (radiator) for any leaks.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: If a large amount of coolant leaks, immediately contact your Toyota dealer.

steptxt.steptxt: The coolant level is satisfactory if it is between the “FULL” and “LOW” lines on the reservoir.
Add engine coolant if necessary.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Water can be used in an emergency if engine coolant is unavailable.

steptxt.steptxt: Start the engine and turn the air conditioning system on to check that the radiator cooling fan operates and to check for coolant leaks from the radiator or hoses.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: The fan operates when the air conditioning system is turned on immediately after a cold start. Confirm that the fan is operating by checking the fan sound and air flow. If it is difficult to check these, turn the air conditioning system on and off repeatedly. (The fan may not operate in freezing temperatures.)

title.title: When inspecting under the hood of your vehicle

p.p: Observe the following precautions. Failure to do so may result in serious injury such as burns.

itemtxt.itemtxt: If steam is seen coming from under the hood, do not open the hood until the steam has subsided. The engine compartment may be very hot.
Keep hands and clothing (especially a tie, a scarf or a muffler) away from the fan and belts. Failure to do so may cause the hands or clothing to be caught, resulting in serious injury.

title.title: When adding engine coolant

p.p: Add coolant slowly after the engine has cooled down sufficiently. Adding cool coolant to a hot engine too quickly can cause damage to the engine.

title.title: To prevent damage to the cooling system

itemtxt.itemtxt: Avoid contaminating the coolant with foreign matter (such as sand or dust etc.).
Do not use any coolant additive.

indexmarker.marker: Emergency, in case of:If your vehicle becomes stuck

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Carry out the following procedures if the tires spin or the vehicle becomes stuck in mud, dirt or snow:

title.title: Recovering procedure

steptxt.steptxt: Stop the engine. Set the parking brake and shift the shift lever to P (continuously variable transmission) or N (manual transmission).
Remove the mud, snow or sand from around the front wheels.
Place wood, stones or some other material under the front wheels to help provide traction.
Restart the engine.
Shift the shift lever to D or R (continuously variable transmission) or 1 or R (manual transmission) and release the parking brake. Then, while exercising caution, depress the accelerator pedal.

title.title: When it is difficult to free the vehicle
When attempting to free a stuck vehicle

p.p: If you choose to push the vehicle back and forth to free it, make sure the surrounding area is clear to avoid striking other vehicles, objects or people. The vehicle may also lunge forward or lunge back suddenly as it becomes free. Use extreme caution.

title.title: When shifting the shift lever (vehicles with a continuously variable transmission)
To avoid damaging the transmission and other components

itemtxt.itemtxt: Avoid spinning the front wheels and depressing the accelerator pedal more than necessary.
If the vehicle remains stuck even after these procedures are performed, the vehicle may require towing to be freed.
